intro: Murdannia loriformis, commonly known as the narrowleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, erect stems and small, alternate leaves. Its flowers are clustered in cyathia, which are cup-like structures characteristic of the genus. Murdannia loriformis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
